alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 6:41PM EDT until July 07 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Columbia, Lincoln, McDuffie and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Martinez, Belvedere, Augusta, Clearwater, Fort Gordon, Edgefield, McCormick, Harlem, Johnston, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Riverwood, Hamilton Branch State Park, Village Plaza Shopping Center and Augusta National Golf Club. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 27. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 177 and 201. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
